summary: Professional crypto swing trading dashboard with real-time price tracking for 20-30 top cryptocurrencies, technical indicators (RSI, MACD, Moving Averages, Bollinger Bands), swing trading signals, portfolio tracker with manual entry, multi-timeframe chart analysis, candlestick pattern recognition, support/resistance detection, market sentiment dashboard, trading journal, dark/light mode, mobile-responsive design, Internet Identity authentication, CoinGecko API integration, Motoko backend, React + TypeScript frontend
architectural_notes: React + TypeScript frontend with Tailwind CSS for styling
Motoko backend for storing user data and preferences
CoinGecko API integration for real-time cryptocurrency price data
Internet Identity for secure user authentication
30-60 second refresh intervals for real-time price updates
Manual trade entry approach for privacy and simplicity
Mobile-responsive design for all screen sizes
In-app toast/banner notifications for real-time trade alerts
Dedicated heatmap page with interactive grid visualization
known_issues: CoinGecko API rate limiting causing dashboard data load failures
AI Trade Analysis card on crypto detail page not displaying entry point price in UI (generateTradeRecommendation calculates it but component doesn't render it)

existing_features.title: Implement real-time price tracking for 20-30 top cryptocurrencies using CoinGecko API with 30-60 second refresh intervals. Display current price, 24h change percentage, 24h volume, and market cap for each cryptocurrency.

Calculate and display technical indicators for each tracked cryptocurrency: RSI (Relative Strength Index), MACD (Moving Average Convergence Divergence), Moving Averages (SMA and EMA), and Bollinger Bands. Use historical price data from CoinGecko API to compute these indicators.

Generate swing trading signals based on standard technical analysis: RSI oversold/overbought zones (buy when RSI < 30, sell when RSI > 70), MACD crossovers (buy on bullish crossover, sell on bearish crossover), and support/resistance level breaks. Display clear buy/sell zones with visual indicators.

Build a portfolio tracker where users can manually enter their trades (cryptocurrency, buy price, quantity, date). Calculate and display current portfolio value, total P&L (profit/loss), individual position P&L, and percentage gains/losses. Store portfolio data in Motoko backend per authenticated user.

Implement a customizable watchlist feature where users can add or remove cryptocurrencies from their personal watchlist. Store watchlist preferences per user in Motoko backend. Display watchlist prominently on dashboard with quick access to tracked coins.

Provide multi-timeframe chart analysis with 1-hour, 4-hour, and daily candlestick charts for each cryptocurrency. Allow users to switch between timeframes seamlessly. Fetch appropriate historical data from CoinGecko API for each timeframe.

Implement candlestick pattern recognition to identify common patterns (e.g., hammer, doji, engulfing patterns, morning/evening star). Highlight detected patterns on charts with labels and descriptions to assist swing trading decisions.

Detect and display support and resistance levels for each cryptocurrency based on historical price action. Mark these levels clearly on charts with horizontal lines. Update levels dynamically as new price data arrives.

Create a market sentiment dashboard aggregating key sentiment indicators: fear/greed index representation, trending cryptocurrencies, top gainers/losers over 24h, and overall market trend (bullish/bearish/neutral). Use CoinGecko API data to derive sentiment metrics.

Build a trading journal feature where users can log their trades with details: entry/exit prices, trade rationale, outcome, and personal notes. Store journal entries per user in Motoko backend. Provide a searchable, filterable view of past trades to review trading performance and strategy.

Implement dark mode and light mode themes with perfect visibility and readability in both modes. Use Tailwind CSS for theming. Provide a theme toggle in the UI. Persist theme preference per user in Motoko backend.

Ensure the entire dashboard is mobile-responsive with layouts that adapt gracefully to different screen sizes (desktop, tablet, mobile). Use Tailwind CSS responsive utilities. Prioritize usability on smaller screens for key features like watchlist, portfolio, and trading signals.

Integrate Internet Identity authentication for secure user login and session management. Require authentication to access portfolio, watchlist, trading journal, and theme preferences. Store user-specific data in Motoko backend keyed by Internet Identity principal.

Design a clean, professional UI with Tailwind CSS that conveys authority and trustworthiness for financial data. Use a cohesive color scheme that avoids clichÃ© blue/purple gradients, clear typography hierarchy, intuitive navigation, and data-dense layouts without clutter. Ensure consistent spacing, alignment, and component styling across all views.

Implement in-app toast/banner notifications that trigger when swing trading signals are generated (RSI oversold/overbought zones, MACD crossovers, support/resistance breaks). Display the notification with cryptocurrency name, signal type (buy/sell), reason, and timestamp. Notifications should appear when the dashboard is open and auto-dismiss after 5-7 seconds with option to dismiss manually.

Create a dedicated Alert History page/view accessible from main navigation that displays all triggered trade alerts for the authenticated user. Show alert timestamp, cryptocurrency, signal type (buy/sell/hold), trigger reason (e.g., 'RSI below 30', 'Bullish MACD crossover', 'Price broke resistance at $50,000'), and confidence level. Include filters by cryptocurrency and signal type. Store alert history per user in Motoko backend with timestamp, crypto ID, signal data, and trigger reason.

Create a new dedicated Market Heatmap page/view accessible from main navigation. Display all 20-30 tracked cryptocurrencies as a visual grid of blocks where block size represents market cap (larger blocks for larger cap coins) and color intensity represents 24-hour price change (green shades for gains, red shades for losses). Clicking a block navigates to that cryptocurrency's detail page. Use a responsive grid layout that adapts to screen size.

Enhance mobile-first responsive design across all new features (alert history page, market heatmap, Fibonacci overlays). Ensure heatmap grid adapts to mobile screens with smaller blocks that remain readable and tappable. Optimize alert history table/list for mobile with card-based layout instead of table on small screens. Ensure toggle controls for heatmap layers are touch-friendly and stack vertically on mobile. Test all interactions on mobile devices to ensure smooth performance and usability.

Implement user-friendly retry buttons in the CryptoTable component and other data-fetching components that display 'Failed to load cryptocurrency data' errors. Add a prominent 'Retry' button centered in the error state UI that triggers a manual refetch of the failed query. Style the button consistently with the existing UI design.

Add exponential backoff retry logic to the useCryptoPrices hook to handle CoinGecko API rate limiting. Configure React Query's retry option with exponential backoff (retryDelay: attempt => Math.min(1000 * 2 ** attempt, 30000)) and set retry count to 3 attempts before showing the error state.

Implement request batching in the coingecko.ts service to fetch cryptocurrency data for multiple coins in a single API call instead of individual requests. Modify fetchCryptoPrices to use CoinGecko's batch endpoint that accepts comma-separated coin IDs (e.g., /coins/markets?vs_currency=usd&ids=bitcoin,ethereum,cardano) to reduce total API call volume.

Add a TimeframeSelector component to the Dashboard page header, positioned prominently between the page title and the CryptoTable. The selector should control the default timeframe for chart previews and data displays across the dashboard. Add a new state variable in Dashboard.tsx to manage the selected timeframe (1H, 4H, Daily) and pass it as a prop to relevant child components that display chart data or technical indicators.

Create a new AI trade recommendation system in the CryptoDetail page that analyzes all available technical data (active signals from useTradingSignals, support/resistance levels from useChartData, detected patterns from useChartData, RSI/MACD/MA/BB values from useTechnicalIndicators) and generates actionable trade recommendations. Display recommendations in a new 'AI Trade Analysis' card component positioned prominently on the CryptoDetail page below the chart section.

Implement the recommendation generation logic in a new utility file frontend/src/utils/aiTradeRecommendations.ts. Create a generateTradeRecommendation function that accepts technical data (signals, indicators, patterns, support/resistance) and returns a structured recommendation object containing: entry point price with reasoning, three take-profit targets (conservative 5-8%, moderate 10-15%, aggressive 20-30% from entry), stop-loss price (positioned below nearest support or 3-5% below entry), overall confidence score (0-100 based on signal strength and indicator alignment), risk level (low/medium/high based on volatility and signal clarity), and detailed reasoning text explaining the recommendation logic.

Display the AI-generated trade recommendation in the 'AI Trade Analysis' card component with a clear visual hierarchy. Show entry point price prominently at the top with an icon and color coding (green for buy entry, red for sell/short entry). Display the three take-profit targets in a horizontal row with badges labeled 'Conservative', 'Moderate', 'Aggressive' showing both price and percentage gain. Show stop-loss price with a warning icon. Display confidence score as a progress bar or percentage badge with color coding (green >70%, yellow 50-70%, red <50%). Show risk level with an appropriate badge. Display the reasoning text in a readable paragraph format at the bottom of the card.

Update the recommendation generation logic to trigger in real-time whenever technical data updates. Configure the AI Trade Analysis component to automatically recalculate recommendations when any of the underlying data sources change (new price data, updated indicators, new patterns detected, changed signals). Display a subtle loading indicator when recalculating recommendations. Add a timestamp to show when the recommendation was last generated.

Update the AITradeAnalysisCard component (frontend/src/components/AITradeAnalysisCard.tsx) to prominently display the entry point price at the top of the card, above the take-profit targets. The entry point should include: the price value with appropriate formatting, color coding (green for buy entry, red for sell/short entry based on recommendation direction), a label 'Entry Point', and the entry reasoning text if available. Ensure the entry point section uses clear visual hierarchy with appropriate spacing, icons, and typography to make it immediately visible to users.

new_feature_requests.summary: Real-time price tracking for 20-30 top cryptocurrencies with 30-60 second refresh intervals
Technical indicators: RSI, MACD, Moving Averages, Bollinger Bands
Swing trading signals based on RSI zones, MACD crossovers, and support/resistance breaks
Manual portfolio tracker with P&L calculations
Customizable watchlist for cryptocurrencies
Multi-timeframe chart analysis (1H, 4H, Daily)
Candlestick pattern recognition
Support/resistance level detection
Market sentiment dashboard
Trading journal for tracking trades
Dark/light mode with mobile-responsive layout
Internet Identity authentication
CoinGecko API integration for real-time crypto prices
Trade alerts triggered by swing trading signals (RSI zones, MACD crossovers, support/resistance breaks) with in-app notifications and alert history page
Market heatmap page with block size by market cap, color intensity by 24h price change, toggleable layers (volume spikes, volatility, BTC correlation, RSI levels)
Volume analysis highlighting unusual volume spikes
Fibonacci retracement overlays on charts
Mobile-first responsive design improvements

Store triggered trading alerts in Motoko backend with fields: timestamp, cryptocurrency ID/symbol, signal type (buy/sell/hold), trigger reason (RSI zone, MACD crossover, support/resistance break), confidence level, and price at trigger. Implement backend functions to add new alerts, fetch alert history for a user (with optional filters by crypto or date range), and optionally purge old alerts (e.g., older than 30 days). Associate alerts with user principals from Internet Identity.

Implement toggleable overlay layers for the Market Heatmap that modify the visual display: 1) Volume Change layer - highlight cryptocurrencies with unusual volume spikes (e.g., >2x average volume) with distinct visual indicator (border, icon, or overlay pattern), 2) Volatility layer - show which coins have highest price volatility independent of direction using color intensity or pattern, 3) BTC Correlation layer - display how closely each altcoin follows Bitcoin's price movements using visual indicators (high correlation vs low correlation), 4) RSI Levels layer - overlay RSI status with color coding (green for oversold <30, red for overbought >70, neutral for mid-range). Provide toggle buttons/checkboxes above the heatmap to enable/disable each layer independently.

Calculate and display volume analysis data showing unusual volume spikes for tracked cryptocurrencies. Compare current 24h volume against average volume over the past 7-30 days. Flag cryptocurrencies where current volume is significantly higher (e.g., >2x or >3x average) as having unusual volume activity. Display this information in the heatmap volume layer and optionally as a dedicated section in the market sentiment dashboard or crypto detail pages.

Add Fibonacci retracement level overlays to the candlestick charts on crypto detail pages. Automatically calculate and draw Fibonacci retracement levels (0%, 23.6%, 38.2%, 50%, 61.8%, 100%) based on the most recent significant price swing (high to low for downtrends, low to high for uptrends) within the visible timeframe. Display levels as horizontal lines with labels showing percentage and price. Provide a toggle to show/hide Fibonacci levels on the chart.
Add user-friendly retry buttons with exponential backoff and request batching to handle API failures gracefully
Add timeframe selector (1H, 4H, Daily) on main dashboard page to control chart displays across watchlist

AI-powered trade recommendation system on coin detail pages that analyzes all technical indicators (signals, support/resistance, patterns, RSI, MACD, MA, BB) to generate entry points, multiple take-profit targets (conservative/moderate/aggressive), stop-loss suggestions, confidence scores, risk levels, and reasoning in real-time
